datasetVariables.name: RSLNKID

datasetVariables.label: Link Group
datasetVariables.name: RSLNKGRP

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the TEST in RSTEST. RSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: TRGRESP, NTRGRESP, OVRRESP, BESTRESP, NRADPROG
datasetVariables.label: Response Assessment Short Name
datasetVariables.name: RSTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the response assessment. The value in RSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Target Response, Non-target Response, Overall Response, Best Overall Response, Non-radiological progression (i.e. Symptomatic deterioration)
datasetVariables.label: Response Assessment Name
datasetVariables.name: RSTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSCAT

datasetVariables.description: RSCAT is used to identify the criteria used in the assessment of response and a version number if appropriate
datasetVariables.label: Category for Response Assessment

priorVersion.title: Response Assessment Result in Std Format

self.title: Response Assessment Result in Std Format

datasetVariables.label: Response Assessment Result in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: RSSTRESC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate the response assessment was not performed. Should be Null if a result exists in RSORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: RSSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why a response assessment was not performed. Examples: All target tumors not evaluated, Subject does not have non-target tumors. Used in conjunction with TRSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Response Assessment Not Performed
datasetVariables.name: RSREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSNAM

datasetVariables.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the response assessment. This column can be left Null when the Investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Vendor Name
datasetVariables.name: RSNAM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Examples: INVESTIGATOR, INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR. This column can be left Null when the Investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However the column should contain no Null values when data from one or more independent assessors is included meaning that the rows attributed to the Investigator should contain a value of INVESTIGATOR.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: RSEVAL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSEVALID

datasetVariables.description: The Evaluator Specified variable is used in conjunction with RSEVAL to provide an additional level of detail. When multiple assessors play the role identified in RSEVAL, values of RSEVALID will attribute a row of data to a particular assessor. RSEVALID should not contain the names of the assessors, or a code identifier for a specific assessor. The RSEVALID variable is subject to CDISC Controlled Terminology. Examples: RADIOLOGIST, RADIOLOGIST 1 or RADIOLOGIST 2. See Assumption 4
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: RSEVALID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSACPTFL

datasetVariables.description: In cases where more than one independent assessor (e.g. RADIOLOGIST 1, RADIOLOGIST 2, ADJUDICATOR) provides an evaluation of response this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted evaluation.
datasetVariables.label: Accepted Record Flag
datasetVariables.name: RSACPTFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: 1. Clinical encounter number.  2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.  2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Epoch associated with the Element in the planned sequence of Elements for the ARM to which the subject was assigned
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSDTC

datasetVariables.description: RSDTC may be derived from the dates of scans/images/physical exams which may be performed on different dates. However, if all assessments are performed on the same date, RSDTC may be consistent with the TUDTC and TRDTC. Note the physical exam date may correspond to the visit date.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Response Assessment
datasetVariables.name: RSDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RS.RSDY

datasetVariables.description: 1. Study day of the response assessment, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Response Assessment
datasetVariables.name: RSDY

description: A findings domain for the assessment of disease response to therapy, or clinical classification based on published criteria. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C107097, 2018-06-29)
label: Disease Response
name: RS
